Values: Caucasian, Asian, African American, Hispanic, and other

Description: Admission Type is used to classify how the patient came to the hospital
Values: Emergency, Trauma Center, Urgent, Elective, and Newborn

Description: The patient's anticipated location or status following the encounter
The source of admission to a hospital
The main condition treated or investigated during the relevant episode of healthcare
Values: Circulatory, Respiratory, Digestive, Diabetes, Injury, Musculoskeletal, Genitourinary, Neoplasms, and Other

Description: Indicates the range of the blood glucose level at the time of of hospital admission
The measurement of Hemoglobin A1c (an important measure of glucose control) at the time of hospital admission
Indicates if there was a change in diabetic medications (either dosage or brand)
Indicates if there was any diabetic medication prescribed
Indicates if the patient was readmitted within 30 days of discharge
Integer number of days between admission and discharge
Number of distinct generic names administered during the encounter
Number of diagnoses entered to the system
Number of total procedures (lab tests and other) performed during the encounter
Number of total visits (outpatient, emergency, and inpatient) of the patient in the year preceding the encounter
